dublin_core.dcvalue: In July 1999 the Argentinean government decided to extend the national telemedicine network from eight to 108 hospitals and medical schools In April 2000 a telemedicine workstation was donated to every hospital although there was no training no guidelines and no overall objectives We have been leading this project since June 2000 as part of the National Information Society Programme with an initial 50 000 US dollars budget for the first semester Since then we have raised funds deployed a large cooperative network and developed training seminars and content We have also proposed an overall action plan Nevertheless the programme in that time has twice suffered a change of government the budget has changed five times and the priorities have changed three times At present the team finds itself with no contract and no political action plan in a national context which is not favourable to information and communications technology projects
Argentina's national telemedicine programme: reasons for a premature failure.
